alert.note: Alert for Northern Trinity; Southern Humboldt Interior (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Freeze Warning issued April 17 at 9:02PM PDT until April 18 at 9:00AM PDT by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 9 AM PDT MONDAY... ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM TO 2 PM PDT MONDAY... * WHAT...For the Freeze Warning, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 28 expected. For the Wind Advisory, south winds 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected. * WHERE...Northern Trinity and Southern Humboldt Interior Counties. * WHEN...For the Freeze Warning, from midnight tonight to 9 AM PDT Monday. For the Wind Advisory, from 8 AM to 2 PM PDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. Frost and freeze conditions will kill crops and other sensitive vegetation.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects. Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. Provide adequate shelter for outdoor pets or consider bringing them indoors. Frost Advisories and Freeze Warnings are issued during the local growing season as defined by climatology and local agriculture experts. Once the growing season has ended these statements will no longer be issued until the spring.
